2025-12-17:
道可道，非常道；名可名，非常名。

The Tao that can be spoken is not the eternal Tao; the name that can be named is not the eternal name.
2025-12-18:
无为而无不为。

Act without forcing, and nothing is left undone.
2025-12-19:
上善若水。水善利万物而不争。

The highest goodness is like water: it benefits all things and does not contend.
2025-12-20:
知人者智，自知者明。

Knowing others is intelligence; knowing yourself is true wisdom.
2025-12-21:
祸兮福之所倚，福兮祸之所伏。

Misfortune is what fortune depends on; fortune is where misfortune hides.
2025-12-22:
大成若缺，其用不弊。

Great perfection seems flawed, yet its usefulness is never exhausted.
2025-12-23:
柔弱胜刚强。

The soft overcomes the hard; the weak overcomes the strong.
2025-12-24:
少则得，多则惑。

Having little leads to clarity; having much leads to confusion.
2025-12-25:
为学日益，为道日损。

In pursuit of knowledge, one gains daily; in pursuit of the Tao, one loses daily.
2025-12-26:
知足不辱，知止不殆。

One who knows contentment avoids disgrace; one who knows when to stop avoids danger.
2025-12-27:
天下难事，必作于易；天下大事，必作于细。
-- 道德经
Difficult things in the world must be done while they are easy; great things must be done while they are small.
--Dao De Jing
2025-12-28:
合抱之木，生于毫末；九层之台，起于累土。
-- 道德经
A tree that fills the arms grows from a tiny shoot; a nine-storey tower rises from a heap of earth.
--Dao De Jing
2025-12-29:
慎终如始，则无败事。
-- 道德经
Be as careful at the end as at the beginning, and there will be no failure.
--Dao De Jing
2025-12-30:
大直若屈，大巧若拙，大辩若讷。
-- 道德经
Great straightness seems bent; great skill seems clumsy; great eloquence seems hesitant.
--Dao De Jing
2025-12-31:
知不知，上；不知知，病。
-- 道德经
To know that you do not know is highest; to think you know when you do not is a sickness.
--Dao De Jing
2026-01-06:
致虚极，守静笃。
-- 道德经
Reach the utmost emptiness; maintain profound stillness.
--Dao De Jing
2026-01-07:
彼亦一是非，此亦一是非。
-- 庄子
That, too, has its right and wrong; this, too, has its right and wrong.
--Zhuangzi
2026-01-08:
人心好静，而欲牵之。
-- 清静经
The human mind loves stillness, yet desire pulls it along.
--Qingjing Jing
2026-01-09:
反者，道之动；弱者，道之用。
-- 道德经
Reversal is the movement of the Tao; weakness is the Tao’s way of functioning.
--Dao De Jing
2026-01-10:
塞翁失马，焉知非福。
-- 淮南子
When the old man at the frontier lost his horse, who could know it was not a blessing?
--Huainanzi
2026-01-11:
子非鱼，安知鱼之乐？
-- 庄子
You are not a fish—how do you know the joy of fish?
--Zhuangzi
2026-01-12:
知不知，上；不知知，病。
-- 道德经
To know that you do not know is highest; to think you know when you do not is a sickness.
--Dao De Jing
2026-01-13:
常能遣其欲，而心自静。
-- 清静经
If one can continually set aside desire, the mind will naturally become still.
--Qingjing Jing
2026-01-14:
吾生也有涯，而知也无涯。
-- 庄子
My life is finite, yet knowledge is infinite.
--Zhuangzi
2026-01-15:
大直若屈，大巧若拙，大辩若讷。
-- 道德经
Great straightness seems bent; great skill seems clumsy; great eloquence seems hesitant.
--Dao De Jing
2026-01-16:
观天之道，执天之行，尽矣。
-- 阴符经
Observe the Way of Heaven; hold to Heaven’s workings—there is nothing more to add.
--Yinfu Jing
2026-01-17:
至人无己，神人无功，圣人无名。
-- 庄子
The perfected person has no self; the spirit-like person claims no achievement; the sage has no name.
--Zhuangzi
2026-01-18:
祸兮福之所倚，福兮祸之所伏。
-- 道德经
Misfortune is what fortune leans on; fortune is where misfortune lies concealed.
--Dao De Jing
2026-01-19:
夫人神好清，而心扰之。
-- 清静经
The human spirit loves clarity, yet the mind disturbs it.
--Qingjing Jing
2026-01-20:
知足不辱，知止不殆。
-- 道德经
Know contentment and avoid disgrace; know when to stop and avoid danger.
--Dao De Jing
2026-01-21:
相濡以沫，不如相忘于江湖。
-- 庄子
Better than moistening each other with spit is to forget one another in rivers and lakes.
--Zhuangzi
2026-01-22:
不出户，知天下；不窥牖，见天道。
-- 道德经
Without leaving the door, one can know the world; without looking out the window, one can see the Way of Heaven.
--Dao De Jing
2026-01-23:
天地与我并生，而万物与我为一。
-- 庄子
Heaven and earth are born with me, and all things are one with me.
--Zhuangzi
2026-01-24:
为学日益，为道日损。
-- 道德经
In pursuit of knowledge, one gains daily; in pursuit of the Tao, one loses daily.
--Dao De Jing
2026-01-25:
道常无为而无不为。
-- 道德经
The Tao constantly acts by non-forcing, yet nothing is left undone.
--Dao De Jing
2026-01-26:
昔者庄周梦为胡蝶。
-- 庄子
Once, Zhuang Zhou dreamed he was a butterfly.
--Zhuangzi
2026-01-27:
上善若水。水善利万物而不争。
-- 道德经
The highest goodness is like water: it benefits all things and does not contend.
--Dao De Jing
2026-01-28:
人能常清静，天地悉皆归。
-- 清静经
If one can remain constantly clear and tranquil, heaven and earth will return to harmony.
--Qingjing Jing
2026-01-29:
合抱之木，生于毫末；九层之台，起于累土。
-- 道德经
A tree that fills the arms grows from a tiny shoot; a nine-storey tower rises from a heap of earth.
--Dao De Jing
2026-01-30:
井蛙不可以语于海，夏虫不可以语于冰。
-- 庄子
You cannot speak of the sea to a frog in a well; you cannot speak of ice to a summer insect.
--Zhuangzi
2026-01-31:
天下难事，必作于易；天下大事，必作于细。
-- 道德经
Difficult things in the world must be done while they are easy; great things must be done while they are small.
--Dao De Jing
